title: San Francisco/Golden Gate
name: West Coast Memorial to the Missing of World War II
address: at Kobbe Ave and Lincoln Blvd
content: One of three memorials on U.S. soil dedicated to missing service members of WWII, the West Coast Memorial is a curved wall of California granite set in a grove of Monterey pine and cypress. Overlooking the Pacific Ocean, it bears the names of 413 members of the Armed Forces who lost their lives or were buried at sea in the offshore Pacific coastal waters.
